WorkItem.Description: Any chance that a form of GPGPU could be added to Rawr to speed up Calculations.  There's vendor specific like Nvidia's CUDA(http://www.nvidia.com/object/cuda_learn.html) or vendor agnostic like DirectCompute(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DirectCompute) and OpenCL(http://www.khronos.org/opencl/).   The addition of these would greatly decrease the time it takes to use the optimization tool, and other similar tools in Rawr.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] General Purpose GPU for Optimization and Other Calculations

Comments.Message:
CUDA: Requires C or C- or C++, we code in C# and SilverLight so that won't work
OpenCL: The page linked discusses C code, no mention of any higher language like C# and from the wording in the slideshow it looks like it would need major rewrites in our code for it to work.
This is all well out of my realm of knowledge, but I did fine this article(http://forums.nvidia.com/index.php?act=ST&f=71&t=67462).  Thank you for your time.

Lemme get this straight. You want a bunch of unpaid theorycrafting enthusiasts who spend their free time to help us deciding about our gear, to totally rewrite their application, potentially spending weeks or months to learn a new programming paradigm, which you yourself admit to understanding nothing about, just to save you 20 seconds when using the optimiser?

Jeez relax a bit!     It was a suggestion to see if it was possible and if it was possible without too much work (I personally have no idea about any of this stuff) then it would be a good addition to Rawr (some optimises take 10+ mins on my relatively powerful PC).    By the sounds of it, it is a lot of work so it is perfectly reasonable to give it a miss.
